benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/resume - Resume a bundle

covered: PUT - Valid Request: Successful resume of a paused bundle returns 204 and updates bundle to active; all paused subscriptions are resumed (TC01).

PUT - Optional inputs: requestedDate schedules resume (TC02); pluginProperty processed (TC03); reason/comment recorded in audit (TC04); only required fields supported (TC18); extra param ignored (TC11); header whitespace/case variations handled (TC26); max header lengths accepted (TC12).

Validation - Path/Header/Query: invalid bundleId format -> 400 (TC06); missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy -> 400 (TC07); pluginProperty wrong type -> 400 (TC19); requestedDate in the past -> 400 (TC20); large pluginProperty list handling/limits (TC13).
Business rules: invalid state transitions are rejected (active or cancelled -> 400) (TC08, TC09).
Non-Existing Resource: 404 when bundle not found (empty DB) (TC05).
Concurrency Issues: Multiple concurrent requests handled (first 204; subsequent 400/409) (TC21).
Server error/timeout handling: dependency down -> 500 (TC14); plugin service degraded -> 204 or 504 (TC25).
Security hardening: SQL injection attempt in pluginProperty safely handled (TC16); XSS attempt in comment safely handled (TC17).
Non-functional: Performance under load (TC22); regression coverage (TC23); backward compatibility with legacy headers (TC24).
gaps: Produces/application/json for 204 vs error responses: No assertions that 204 responses have no body and appropriate headers, or that error responses use application/json as specified.
Non-existing resource (data-present case): No explicit 404 scenario for a non-existent bundleId when other bundles exist (only empty DB case covered).
requestedDate format edge cases: No tests for invalid date format (e.g., 2025-13-40), timezone/offset handling (if any), or same-day/today boundary behavior.
pluginProperty collectionFormat=multi: No scenario validating repeated query parameters (pluginProperty=a&pluginProperty=b), URL-encoding, empty values, or duplicate keys.
Unexpected request body: Request body is N/A, but there is no negative test ensuring a non-empty body is rejected with 400/415 or safely ignored.
Idempotency around scheduled resumes: No scenarios for a second resume call before the requestedDate effective time (expected 400/409) and after it becomes active.
Audit log completeness: Only verifies presence when reason/comment provided; does not verify CreatedBy, reason, and comment fields are correctly captured/omitted across success/error paths.
Error response schema: Tests check for error message text but don’t validate structured error fields (e.g., code, message, type) in the JSON body.
Header name case-insensitivity: No scenario verifying that differently cased header names (e.g., x-killbill-createdby) are accepted per HTTP semantics.
Multi-subscription behavior nuance: Only states "all subscriptions are resumed"; no test that non-paused subscriptions remain unchanged while paused ones resume (mixed-state bundle).
recommendations: Add checks for 204 responses to assert empty body and consistent headers; assert error responses return application/json with a defined schema (code/message/type).
Create a 404 test using a random non-existent UUID while the database contains other bundles (non-empty DB case).
Expand requestedDate tests: invalid format (YYYY-MM-DD validation), today vs future behavior, and clarify/verify timezone handling if applicable.
Validate pluginProperty as collectionFormat=multi using repeated query parameters, including URL-encoded values, duplicates, and empty values; assert server behavior.
Add a negative test that sends a JSON body to the PUT endpoint and verify it is rejected (400/415) or ignored per spec; document expected behavior.
Add idempotency tests around scheduled resumes: second call before effective date and immediately after effective date, with expected status codes (400/409/204) clearly defined.
Augment audit log checks to assert CreatedBy is recorded for all requests and reason/comment are captured only when provided; verify audit entries on both success (204) and failure (4xx).
Validate a consistent error response schema across 400/404/500/504, not just message substrings.
Add a scenario asserting header name case-insensitivity for X-Killbill-CreatedBy.
Refine mixed-state verification: seed a bundle with both paused and active subscriptions and assert only paused subscriptions transition to active after resume.
